title: 114_hr3581
content: The Act may be cited as the "Keep Our Promise to America's Children and Teachers Act" or the "Keep Our PACT Act". The Congress acknowledges the importance of children as the nation's future and the need for high-quality education to fulfill their potential. Title I of the Elementary and Secondary Schools Act aims to address education inequity, while the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act ensures quality education for children with disabilities. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Improvement Act commits to providing adequate funding for students with disabilities. For fiscal years 2016 and 2017, funding is appropriated for programs under part A of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 based on the difference between the amount allocated in the previous year and a specified amount. For fiscal years 2018 and 2019, funding for programs under part A of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is determined by the difference between the amount appropriated in fiscal year 2015 and a specified amount. For fiscal years 2020 and 2021, funding for programs under part A of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is determined by the difference between the amount appropriated in fiscal year 2015 and a specified amount. For fiscal years 2020 and 2021, funding for programs under part A of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 is determined by the difference between the amount appropriated in fiscal year 2015 and a specified amount. For fiscal year 2022 and 2023, funding amounts are calculated similarly based on the appropriations for fiscal year 2015. For fiscal year 2024, the funding for programs under part A of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 will be determined by the difference between the amount appropriated in fiscal year 2015 and $41,838,368,000 or the full authorized amount, whichever is higher. For fiscal year 2025, the funding for programs under part A of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 will be determined by the difference between the amount appropriated in fiscal year 2015 and $47,098,809,000 or the full authorized amount, whichever is higher. SEC. 4. MANDATORY FUNDING OF THE INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES EDUCATION ACT. Section 611(i) of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act is amended to authorize specific funding amounts for fiscal year 2016, with $12,872,421,000 or 17.7 percent of the determined amount for certain purposes, and $1,374,573,000 or 1.6 percent for other purposes. For fiscal years 2017 and 2018, specific funding amounts are authorized under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. $2,913,478,000 or 3.3 percent of the determined amount for 2017, and $16,134,207,000 or 21.2 percent for 2018, are appropriated for certain purposes. Additionally, $4,636,359,000 or 5.1 percent for 2018 is allocated for other purposes. For fiscal years 2019 and 2020, specific funding amounts are authorized under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. $18,063,059,000 or 23.2 percent for 2019, and $20,222,507,000 or 25.4 percent for 2020, are appropriated for certain purposes. Additionally, $6,565,211,000 or 7.1 percent for 2019, and $8,724,659,000 or 9.3 percent for 2020, are allocated for other purposes. For fiscal year 2020, $8,724,659,000 or 9.3 percent of the determined amount is available for obligation from July 1, 2020, through September 30, 2021. For fiscal year 2021, $22,640,117,000 or 27.8 percent is available, with $11,142,269,000 or 11.7 percent becoming available from July 1, 2021, through September 30, 2022. Additionally, $25,346,755,000 or 30.5 percent is allocated for another purpose. For fiscal year 2022, $25,346,755,000 or 30.5 percent of the determined amount is appropriated, with $13,848,907,000 or 14.4 percent becoming available from July 1, 2022, through September 30, 2023. For fiscal year 2023, $28,376,972,000 or 33.4 percent is allocated, with $16,879,124,000 or 17.3 percent becoming available. For fiscal year 2023, $31,769,453,000 or 36.5 percent of the determined amount is appropriated, with $20,271,605,000 or 20.4 percent becoming available from July 1, 2023, through September 30, 2024. For fiscal year 2024, $35,567,506,000 or 40 percent is allocated, with the same availability for subsequent fiscal years. For fiscal year 2025 and onwards, $35,567,506,000 or 40% of the determined amount is appropriated, whichever is greater. The funds will be available for obligation from July 1 of each fiscal year through September 30 of the following year. The amount determined under this paragraph is based on the total number of children with disabilities who received special education services in the previous school year and the average per-pupil expenditure in public schools. The amount determined is based on the total number of children with disabilities who received special education services in the previous school year and the average per-pupil expenditure in public schools. SEC. 5. OFFSET. The amounts appropriated by this Act and the amendments made by this Act shall be expended consistent with pay-as-you-go requirements.
